content.description: Start on low jugs, move up and left on the face using jugs and pinches. I saw actual wasps on the rock when I was out there, so I guess that's where the name comes from. Crux is the awkward down climb.
content.protection: Spotter and pad. Pad wouldn't hurt for the down climb.
content.location: If you're looking at Getcha Some, turn around. There is another boulder and on the corner to your right is the start for Wasp.

content.description: Sit start low in jug. Climb groove to sloping mantle. Start jug is large hole/pocket.
content.protection: pad plus spotter or two pads
content.location: Middle-corner of the high life boulder facing the bend in the main trail towards Redneck. Opposite of Wasp. Also left of the giant hueco that is the start of Getcha Some.

content.description: Stand start on decent holds, get positive grabs depending on the angle and climb face to the left of the tree. Awkward little V1
content.location: On corner of the main boulder, to the left of the two tree down climb.

content.description: Sit very low on edges. Climb face into corner on small crimps
content.location: Left side of Highlife Boulder. Left of Lawdog. Right of the easier holds as seen on the Kind Flake.

content.description: Climb High Life but use the rightmost jug too. Another sandbagged V3.
content.location: Middle/Left of High Life boulder facing main trail.

content.description:
SDS with right hand in obvious large pocket & left on edge. Move up past some cool opening moves to reach a shallow right hand pocket. Figure out how to stabilize in the pocket and make the long move to the good hold up and left (crux). Keep your head together for a rather difficult mantle.

 copied from temphp40
content.location: Obvious problem just around the corner left of "High Life"

content.description: Start on low and sharp jugs. Move to left side pull, right hand to sloping jug, undercling on what looks to be a pinch and stand into the large pocket with your right hand. Left hand to MAJOR jug, slow moves for a sloper top out just to be safe. Down climb at the two tree'd corner.
content.protection: Spotter, pads. Multiple roots at base of problem
content.location: Next to the Crown Boulder on the corner, backed up to the lookout point. There should be a small walkway between the crown boulder and highlife on the left when facing this problem.

content.description: Start on jugs climb face up
content.location: Middle of left side of Highlife Boulder facing trail.

content.description: Stand start. Climb pocketed face. Reachy but use good foot beta.
content.location: Faces you as you come to the left bend in the main trail at the end of the eightball boulder.

content.description: Sit start low, use crimp band, slopers, and maybe bad pocket to move right and up. Tough throw to top sloper. Best, rightmost jug hole is off for V6.
content.location: Middle/left on high life boulder facing main trail.

content.description: Sit start very low on pockets. Hard moves to the right then up.
content.location: Left side of Highlife Boulder facing trail.

content.description: Low start on good holds in rounded out area of the rock next to the tree. Traverse right to pinches and then good side pull. Move left to undercling and go up and over. Feet are tough- for the pinches a small perch with an awkward foot switch might be needed. Bunchy for the taller folk. Go further right to jugs for a V7 top out- if you want some more (problem is named Gimme Some Mo')
content.location: Next to large tree, rounded out hole in rock. Down climb is at tourist attraction/two tree'd corner.

content.description: Sit start low as Getcha Some. Traverse with pockets and such to the right instead of topping out. Top out as HL slab.
content.protection: multi pads under lowball crux or spotter to move pad.
content.location: Starts in large hueco to the right of a tree. Middle of main side of highlife boulder, traverses right.

content.description: Sit start and climb bulbous face
content.location: In first corridor between Highlife boulder and Eightball boulder. Just left of arete by downclimb tree.

content.description: Shady for the majority of the day. Has some conglomerations across the face. Awkward down climb whether on the main boulder or the smaller boulder of this area.
